Looking at the View Manager Window

 

 

To display the View Manager window, select View > View Manager from the menu bar of the Cross-Platform client.

The View Manager window has two upper panes and a lower pane. The upper panes display the project-view-folder trees for the server configuration, while the lower pane contains a combination tree and list control.

Using the Upper Panes

In the upper panes, projects, views, and folders are nodes on the selected Source server (left pane) and Target server (right pane) trees. The icons indicate the type of node and whether the node contains unresolved files.

To select or change the source and target objects, you can use menu options or open a properties file containing a pair of objects and options saved in the past.

When you select a view or folder from the left pane, the right pane must contain either the same type of object as the left pane or, in the case of a folder, an object one type higher. If you select a view, the merge process applies to that view's folders or to that view's folders, child views, and their folders, depending on the options you have selected. The same principle applies to the folders you select.

Using the Lower Pane

The lower pane has two tabs, one for Preview and one for Run.

  • The Preview pane displays the results as they would occur in a source-to-target, bidirectional, or missing-objects-only synchronization.

    • Source-to-target synchronization. Corresponding files can be merged and checked in to the target. Missing objects can be added and deleted. Specific details are based on option settings.

    • Bidirectional synchronization. Corresponding files are merged and can be checked in to both the source and the target. Missing objects can be added and deleted. Specific details are based on option settings.

    • Missing-objects-only synchronization. Missing objects can be added and/or deleted, based on option settings. No merging takes place.

    This pane does not show the results of a copy-to-target operation, as such operations are more predictable. In a copy-to-target operation, View Manager copies the source object as a child of the target object. No merging takes place. If you select a folder from the left pane and a view from the right pane, the copy-to-target operation is the only operation available.

  • The Run pane shows the results of the operation after you perform it.

Regardless of the tab you select, the lower pane contains a combination tree and list control. Each node of the tree has accompanying columns of information.

To control the kinds of data displayed in the tree:

Do one of the following:

  • Select or clear the checkmark in front of Display > Minimal Tree in Preview and Run Panes on the menu bar. The minimal tree displays only projects, views, folders, and files that will change as a result of the run operation or that have changed.

  • Click the Show Complete Tree button or the Show Minimal Tree button on the toolbar.

The tree shows the contents of both the source and the target objects. When the names of two objects are not the same, the name of the target object appears in the tree. The list displays properties of the objects in columns.

If you right-click a node in the tree and hold the mouse button down, the properties for the object associated with that node appear in a dialog. This information is the same as that displayed in columns in the lower pane.

Understanding the Columns on the Lower Pane

The column headings for the lower pane are:

  • Name, which lists the names of the source and target objects. In general, both the source and target objects have the same name. When the names are different, the name of the target object is shown in this column, which appears in both the Preview and Run panes.

  • Locked By, which lists the name of the person locking the file and whether the file is locked in the source, target, or both. This column appears only in the Preview pane. If either the source or target is locked, the lock is reported, even if the lock may not necessarily cause the operation to fail. Lock information appears in the Result column in the Run pane if an operation fails because of a lock.

  • Preview Status or Run Status, which is a text description of the relationship between two corresponding objects. All View Manager files have statuses. For more information, see Understanding File Status in View Manager. The server never shows a status. Projects, views, and folders do not show a status unless they exist in the source or the target object only.

  • Action, a text description of the action to be taken, given the status and option settings. This column appears in both the Preview and Run panes.

  • Result, a text description of the outcome of the selected operation on the two corresponding objects. This column is displayed only in the Run pane. All files have results, while the server never shows a result. Projects, views, and folders show no results unless they are added, deleted, or moved.

  • Source Revision, which is the number of the source's tip revision. This column appears in both the Preview and Run panes and shows the object's current tip revision numbers.

  • Target Revision, which is the number of the target's tip revision. This column appears in both the Preview and Run panes and shows the object's current tip revision numbers.
